number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 30
												first of all I have to say I am not the biggest fan of UBisoft in any way but this game surprised me. Had Hours of fun and counting. Its a great game, my favorite mode so far is wingsuit. snowboarding and ski's are fun as well but the wingsuit takes the cake. The paragliding is the absolute worst thing the challenges associated with it are a headache. to go fast just dont try to move at all unless nessacary or else you slow down massivly.  the map is huge and its very fun to explore, you can find cool places to board or fly through and I am yet to touch Alaska. The real turn off is the requirement to be constatnly connected to the internet. At first I thought "hey this isn't too bad" but the very slightest lag spike can REALLY ruin what could be a great run. especially when you are right infront of the finishline with a gold medal in the bag and the next thing you know your running into a tree and everything is ruined. This changed my opinion about internet connection real quick. Another complaint (Although minor) is the fact that you have to download U Play and have to have an account. I bought the game off of steam ubisoft i shouldnt have to download your own knock off of steam in order to play as well. If thats going to be the case take your games off of steam, its running memory that does not need to be ran.    Ubisoft did make leaps and bounds of improvements to the game since open beta and I am very happy with that. Overall i would rate this game a solid 8 out of 10. their price is a little steep (no pun intended) so i would highly reccomend to wait until the game is on sale. i got the gold edition at a half off sale and 40 bucks for all the dlc and a season pass is a fair price. I would love for Ubi to add extra trick options to the ski or snowboards such as grinding, for rooftops, Those fence things and the edges of the halfpipes. also proabally a different mode, maybe tubing or sleding? or having fun on a snowmobile? its just a thought. overall check the game out, very fun, lots to do and a good community.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2016
												Love this game so far.Out of all the ski and snow games I've played (SSX 1-3, SNOW, Amped) this is hands down my FAVORITE. If you do not like your snow sports games to be realistic however, then you may want to stay away from this title. It is NOT meant to be an arcade game.Pros:+Amazing graphics and environment to explore+Customization (character, graphics, music, etc.)+Variety of sports and sports events for riders of all skill level+No loading times+Multiplayer / sharing challenges with other ridersCons:-Price (Realistically worth $39.99 IMO)-User interface can be a bit cluttered at times-Physics can be a bit frustrating at times-No grindingThe gameplay IS challenging, but I play with a controller and after a few hours I was hooked and having tons of fun..

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 7, 2016
												   Whatever you guys think about Ubi, they definetly nailed this one.    If you love racing, skateboarding or just love sports, this is a game for you: Progression system is simple, do activities to level up and gain in game credit in order to unlock or buy all kinds of gear,these gears are all cosmatic, won't affect your performance.Also they have licenses from North Face Salomon and GoPro.    Control is a little hard to familiarize, but just like real snowboarding or skiing, everything needs some practice. Have a controller to play this game is highly recommended but keyboard is not unplayable at all.    A big beautiful open world, dev team's office is located right below Alps, so map model is just outside their office.( And they are gonna add Alaska as DLC)    Game's a MMO, so you can constantly see players doing activities or team up with someone to do some awesome stunts, crack some bones and laugh at each other's crash. Fun is overloading if you have one or two friends playing together    Except for losing connection and Uplay can't log in, everything is perfect.    Ultimatly, you spend full prize to skiiing snowboarding and doing wingsuit jump in one of the most beautiful open world you can get. So grab some buddies, do some stunts crack some bones laugh at each other and have some fun, it's totally worth the prize.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 7, 2016
												Best winter sports game every created period, and in a open world at that.Graphics are really good, nothing ground breaking but really good. I used a i7 2600k, 8gb RAM, 980ti, game runs greats on my 1080p, 120hz monitor, honestly haven't checked frames, it's smooth! Sound is great, and the music is top notch, and gets you in the zone.The different sports are all fun and have their place, the physics feel great when snowboarding and skiing, they each feel unique though. Wingsuit has to be one of the best things to do in the game and the feel is spot on, and it's just alot of fun. Paragliding is great for exploring and getting up the mountains quickly, but kinda boring.Controls with keyboard are okay but you really should get a controller if you want to play this game. The controller I used was DS4 and it works great, I really have no issues with how the controlls are and they eare simple and easy to learn.The map is huge, I really don't know how else to describe it, Alaska is coming next for free and it's the same size, can't wait to see what the dev have in store. Mapview is great way to see the whole map, but its controlls are kinda okay with a keyboard, and not great with a controller, they could have done a bit better with both.Tricks are alot of fun and there is alot of them, but the game lacks grinding or boxes for the snow parks, and that is unfortunate, hopefully maybe it is added at a later date. The G-force system is very important to pay attention to and I actually like this feature, watch your speed and where and how you land your tricks.Customization, there is alot of options when it comes to looking differen't, you have different models, genders, you can customize the snowboards, skiis, all the clothing n chutes, and there is constumes if you like that.Challenges and missions, there is a main Mountain Storie missions that have you follow certain people, or do certain objectives with a short story or sometimes puzzle. Challenges are all over the map and are the main activities in the game, range from races, to trick parks.There are different play styles in the game and you can choose to go down any path, but you will find youself doing all of them I am sure. Every mission or challenge has a playstyle that goes along with it. The playstyles are, Extreme, Explorer, Pro Rider, Freestyler, Bone Collector, Free Rider.Multiplayer, there is a COOP aspect to the game with leaderboards, where the game will often just find players that are near you and you guys will end up playing together. It's one massive world and server but you can only see 3 other ppl at a time, and they are zoned in. You can also party up using UPlay, to make finding and playing with your friends easier.All and all, it's really a fun, chill game even for the steep price.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 7, 2016
												I think this is currently the best open world Skiing/Snowboarding Game out there.Traverse a large mountain terrain and explore to your hearts content. If you can see it you can walk to it, you can ski on it or you can fly over it.The visuals are amazing, excellent graphics. Decent music/sound effects. Gameplay can be either immensely challenging or soothingly chill as you carve up the slopes pulling off insane tricks or just exploring the vast and beautiful environment.Most of the challenges arent too hard, but there are a few that will have you raging hard to beat them. It was personally pretty satsifying to overcome these, but they are mostly the higher level challenges.The biggest complaint I have seen is about the price tag. Is it worth $60? .. maybe, it is for me personally as I intend to be playing it often just to relax and explore and remind myself of Skiing. This means I will eventually sink at least 80 to 100 hours into the game easily, thus making it a solid investment. If you're looking for something more than that, then maybe perhaps wait for the price to come down a bit to around $40.After about 20 hours of gameplay I have hit max level and unlocked all the mountains, but there is still tonnes of challenges left that I haven't yet gotten gold on and plenty of drop-points/points of interest still left to find.IMO: If you want a Skiing Game that focuses primarily on exploration, then I would say that this is worth getting it for the full price. If you are looking for anything else, wait for a sale.

												I bot love and absolutly detest this game. The winsuit section is amazing and so much fun. The parachute sections are very fun and it is awesome trying to figureout new routes to get better times. The races are also amazing and provide a good challenge. The problem I have is the tricks. They are disasterously bad. To semiconsistantly do tricks you have to compleetly release the sticks and even then I have times when it does nothing at all or what I did not want it to do. For me doing a line of tricks is nrealy impossible in some section as I have to adjust the characters direction and cant let go of the sticks to setup a trick. It is the most frustrating part and sadly it kills the fun of the game when I have to do these sections to progress in the game. If you dont mind the frustratinly bad trick system it is an amazing game and so much fun to explore.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2016
												Absolutely amazing!  First off, use an Xbox controller if you have one, keyboard works, but the controller is much better.  It took me a good hour into the game before I realized just how great of a job they've done.  The map is a lot bigger than I first realized.  I really enjoy the "Far Cry" style exploration which requires you to get close enough to a zone before using your binoculars to "unlock" it.  Once a zone is unlocked you gain direct access to the events in that zone.  At first the map seems barren and somewhat small, until you realize that's only because you haven't unlocked the rest.The game really starts to shine once you gain access to higher elevations.  The sense of scale and steepness is truly amazing.  Exploring in this game is great fun.  Once I learned to ride up-currents with the paraglider I was to start unlocking areas quickly.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 4, 2016
												The last time I played a snow sports game, it was SSX on my old gamecube. I'm not really into sports game usually, but this one is an exception. For me, Steep is a great game.The graphics are impressive even without maxing everything out. I didn't encounter any really bothering glitches/bugs, and it runs well. The gameplay is also quite good, the controls are easy to get and, I think, fine, at least for people who don't go skiing or snowboarding every week-end and who want to control every flexion/inflexion and force on the snowboard. I also find that difficulty and fun are truly well balanced.But what I love even more, is that this is immersive af.After 5 hours of gameplay (and I'm not going to stop), I've only encountered minor bugs, which I think will be fixed soon, like in the next patch. For example, when I customize a rider, play and log off, the outfit will get reset the next time I'm going to play. You don't lose progression, just the outfits are reset to default. Same for the audio preferences (music style, playlist, etc ...) Minor bugs.So, despite few minor bugs, I would highly recommand this game if you want to relax and have fun in the end of the day or with your friends. Especially if you like immersion, speed and snowy mountains ^^.If you think it's too expensive, well, wait a few weeks or for some sales and you're good to go.If you think it will feel empty and boring, well, I think it's subjective, but for me it's absolutely not empty and boring. Huge map with tons of different places, challenges, cliffs ... when man, a simple ride feels really really good.That said, I'm sure you just have to check the discussions and you will find the exact opposite of my review.Well, that's normal, it's all kind of subjective after all and it depends of what you expect from this game.Hope this review helps.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2016
												The Mountains are Massive!  A Seemingly endless wonderland,  Steep is full of Bliss.Im a Snowboard Instructor at my local playground in RL. Steep brings the feel of snowboarding to my PC perfectly.  The mountains are majestic the snow is magnificent.  The selection of gear, the great costumes and helmets, among many other customization options.  Steep comes to life in so many ways.  I dont know much about anything other than snowboarding but I love doing it all in game. The Tricks in Steep are WAY better than Iv read about from other people, so much more realistic than other games like it.  I couldnt do half the tricks you can do in Steep in RL.  If you wanna know what kinda stuff you can do in game, check out the Snowboard Tricks Wiki online.Steep has a lack of board brands but Im sure we could see more in the future. Right now they have Jones, Salomon, Nidecker, K2, Yes, and "Steep" snowboards. Id like to see them add Never Summer, Arbor, and Lib Tech just to name a few.  I love snowboarding, as my job and for fun, Steep really brings me to the mountains at the comfort of my PC.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2016
												Love this game so far.Out of all the ski and snow games I've played (SSX 1-3, SNOW, Amped) this is hands down my FAVORITE. If you do not like your snow sports games to be realistic however, then you may want to stay away from this title. It is NOT meant to be an arcade game.Pros:+Amazing graphics and environment to explore+Customization (character, graphics, music, etc.)+Variety of sports and sports events for riders of all skill level+No loading times+Multiplayer / sharing challenges with other ridersCons:-Price (Realistically worth $39.99 IMO)-User interface can be a bit cluttered at times-Physics can be a bit frustrating at times-No grindingThe gameplay IS challenging, but I play with a controller and after a few hours I was hooked and having tons of fun..

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 7
												Brief summary: the concept for this game is great. It plays out pretty well and enjoyable overall, but there are MAJOR problems that turn an otherwise great game into a very average, blood pressure raising s***show. The controls are pretty easy to pick up and doing tricks is fairly simple. The game has a very large map and once it is loaded from the menu, you will not have any loading screens while you move about to different peaks. [This part has the negative aspects] HOWEVER, there are some absolutely gamebreaking problems with this game. First of all, the physics engine is completely broken AND the game is unforgiving.  It would be one thing to have a bad physics system with forgiving gameplay, but Ubisoft says F%%% you, we don't care. The physics engine has no idea what friction is nor how gravity works. If your board TOUCHES anything other than snow, you are dead. The rocks will either have infinite friction, act like magnets and suck you into them, or launch you at infinite speed. This is a major problem in some challenges (BOBSLED CHALLENGE) because the physics make it impossible to even complete. In addition to this, jumping is cruel. You have to jump well before you leave the ramps, so many of the smaller jumps are practically impossible to time properly. You end up with a .05 second window to execute a jump or you fail.NEUTRAL PIECES. The characters are either forgettable or obnoxious. They try to make a story or something out of the game, but nothing is coherent and you just cram challenges in so you get gear, XP, and credits. It would be cool (and really easy) if they made this something like a "career mode" and you created a character and progressed through challenges (kind of like Tony Hawk's Underground back in the day). You just get to Mont Blanc as quickly as possible and forget about any dialogue or any sort of narrative the game tries to feed you.Overall, it is hard to recommend this game. If you can find it on sale, buy it. I paid $40 but still feel bad about the price. If you can get it for $30 or less, then buy it. The concept is excellent and the game is great fun when it is working properly. HOWEVER, when the game is NOT working properly (physics engine, I am looking at you), then it makes you want to punt puppies across the room.tl;dr the game has its moments, but it is so broken in other aspects that it only makes it a 6.5 out of 10. Some challenges are great fun and others make your blood boil.Fix the physics engine and it will easily be a solid 8.5/10. This game is AWESOME when it is working correctly.

Posted: December 29, 2016
												Steep is an amazing exploration game disguised as an extreme winter sports game. There are, of course, snowboards, skis, wing suits, and parachutes. However, these can be used as tools to discover the massive open-world mountain range as much as they can be used for time challenges and stunts. The joy of this game is hiking the back country and creating your own line on a hidden slope. Steep, in many ways, is about creating your own fun. There is no official cross country skiiing in this game, but you can create your own cross country skiing event. There is no official ice skating in this game, but I once spent 15 minutes ice skating with another player on a frozen lake reachable only by wingsuit and parasail. I once spent 30 minutes climbing a mountain and found kristib112 just sitting at the summit, alone. We waved, stood a while longer, then both base jumped off the cliff, never to see each other again.“You cannot stay on the summit forever; you have to come down again. So why bother in the first place? Just this: What is above knows what is below, but what is below does not know what is above. One climbs, one sees. One descends, one sees no longer, but one has seen.” -- René Daumal, Mount Analogue

content:
Posted: December 29, 2016
												So I'm not going to give it a thumbs down, but I will say that despite how much I wanted to enjoy this game, it just wasn't for me. First off, yes, I have less than an hour of gameplay, not nearly enough time put in to give any sort of review. So I will say that I would still recommend this game, as I do like the concept, but I just felt that me personally wouldn't be putting much time into it. So for the Pros;      ~   Beautiful scenery and well optimized. Very rarely would I have any kind of fps drop.      ~   As a long time snowboarding fan, I like how it feels like, well, snowboarding. It has a slight arcade feeling, but for the most part it doesn't feel over the top.      ~   Squirrel suit is pretty fun. Fast and can be a bit tricky, but still fun.      ~   I like the idea of an open world, desipte me not putting the time in to actually explore, the freedom of being able to  choose where you want to go, or start is pretty cool.Cons; (Just me personally)      ~   I didn't really care for the controls too much, and yes, I was using and xbox one controller. It just feels a bit odd and clunky.      ~   Over saturation of tutorials. I am the kind of person, whether it be a movie or a game, if I'm not sucked in pretty quick I'll lose interest. So spending the first 20 or so minutes of the game going through the motions of the different sports, locations, line challenges, etc... was a bit of a turn off. I like to be placed in a world and have to just figure the game out. Much like Dark Souls I guess you could say.      ~   Always online: While this isn't a huge problem for me personally I could see how it could be for others. I spend a lot of time away from home in hotels, so trying to do any online gaming on unstable hotel wifi isn't the most fun thing in the world. So overall I would give it a 5/10. Which is a shame because I really wanted to love this game. While the lack of arcade is what was appealing to me, maybe that's what this game needs more of. So if you're a wintersports fan, I still recommend this game. But if you're anything like me, and some of these cons outweighted the pros, then I would suggest holding off until a price drop, or maybe some tweaks and/or content patches.

												It was very hard to judge Steep with the lack of Extreme Snowboarding games there is. I wouldnt have expected Ubisoft to pull one out let alone a good one. I loved the SSX series and was very curious with Steep not knowing much about it other than its vast world with some MMO to it. Pros;Huge world to exploreAmazing graphics, sound, OSTVery realistic which limits your movementAbility to switch between Ski's and board or simply walkParachuting and GlidingOptimized surprisingly well with just enough power for 4K qualityRed BullGood customization and no microtransactionsCalming and RelaxingCons;G-Force bar can be too sensitiveNeeds a bigger playlistNo weather effects apart from day/nightNo photo modeWorld map lacks NPC & animalsSome buildings should let you go inside Needs a bigger trick bookChallanges sometimes feel unrewarding No proper races between other players/NPC'sAll in all I think Ubisoft have done well and hope it gets continued support and expands on it

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 13
												I've accumulated 31 hours so far over the game and the beta and I highly recommend this game. If you're into snowboarding or skiing type of games, like the old 1080° on the nintendo 64, then you will feel a familiar excitement in playing Steep.   The visuals are beautiful and stunning when properly set up in the options menu. Although to run the game on max settings will take a pretty good GPU, most modern cards won't have any problem handling it on High or Medium. The game engine itself runs extremely well as the physics seem very fluid and lifelike. There is a real level of depth and skill to the game that actually challenges the most dedicated players. Some challenges I found myself trying for hours just to break my top score and then after that, the best score in the world on the leaderboard.  Every good thing has to come with a little bad right, well in this case it's true. Steep to me as a game doesn't feel "complete". The up and coming DLC's seem to have several sports that I would have loved to have included in the base game and not in seasoned releases. For example, Basejumping, Rocketwings and the Bobsleigh will be adding in at later times and of course, you need the Season Pass (30$CAD) to have access to these. Hey at least the new map isn't DLC required, so that's a plus.  The only other downside that I would mention is like the recent Hitman, Steep is an online only game. Though most people wouldn't be phased by this, I've seen some pretty hateful comments going around on this subject.   In terms of multiplayer playability I would recommend finding someone to ride with since meeting people in-game is technically difficult. The only way of interacting with other players is by inviting them to your group or by playing a character emote next to them that spouts out random voice lines. Given that form of communication it's hard to make initial contact with other players in the open world. All in all, Steep is a wonderful game to pass time on and enjoy for hours. You will often find yourself wondering where your past couple of hours went.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 12
												Sportsgame 5/10Environment and nature 10/10Overall 7/10This game is frustrating. Not because its easy, not because its hard, but because it has that annoying combination of brilliance and lazy shortcuts. If you are looking for a snowboard/alpine sportsgame, then Steep will frustrate you endlessly. But at the same time, if you're (like me) not looking for a wingsuit/paraglider, then Steep will surprise you. Its remarkable how the core substance of snowboard and ski are so poorly developed as it is, while the two spicey alternatives both excell so well.I bought Steep for the snowboard offpist sensation. And thats why ive stayed with it. The beauty of this game is remarkable, the snow-physics, the glare, the sound ... it gives me goosebumps regularly, thats how good it is! Steep has genius aspects to it that they just got right. The mapdesign, the quick restartbutton (which had me always doing 20-30 attempts than I intended), the partially amazing voicecasting. These things are a big plus. Thats why its so frustrating that the negatives are just as big. Snowboard and ski has glue-physics to non-snow substance (a small rock can slingshot you 120 degrees around f.ex.), its impossible to swap or pick which direction you want to accelerate, some challenges have ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ pitches and voices, customization of riders are weak, jumps and tricks and score system all make equally little sense. Riding 20m on ice can score just as high as a 1080 tweak for example, whats up with that?? The design choice by devs to build the game up around a «carrier» is a good one, but alas a poorly executed one. In summary, most of these flaws to the game feels to me like they were caused by a lack of more time for developing.All in all, I recommend. Pray that they patch and update the game further. Steep is a dirty, muddied gem. May it shine brighter one day soon.

content:
Posted: January 7
												Steep is one of the few games I've played that successfully manages to create a good balance between atmosphere and intensity. Some of the events require you to scream down mountains and barely make it alive, while others have you wander through the beautiful landscape trying to make your way to an end point. Of course, you can also do both of those things without events telling you to do so because of the open world.The controls work great for me (using an Xbox 360 controller) and the leveling system in different areas (Extreme riding, freestyling, etc.) works well too. The multiplayer function also works well as you can set group records for events and challenge your friends or just explore together.However, in my opinion, the skis and snowboards are so similar that I only find myself using the skis every once in a while. I would have liked more depth in some sort of story but the system of completing single events works well.Overall, a great game well worth the $40 I paid on sale.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 7
												Brief summary: the concept for this game is great. It plays out pretty well and enjoyable overall, but there are MAJOR problems that turn an otherwise great game into a very average, blood pressure raising s***show. The controls are pretty easy to pick up and doing tricks is fairly simple. The game has a very large map and once it is loaded from the menu, you will not have any loading screens while you move about to different peaks. [This part has the negative aspects] HOWEVER, there are some absolutely gamebreaking problems with this game. First of all, the physics engine is completely broken AND the game is unforgiving.  It would be one thing to have a bad physics system with forgiving gameplay, but Ubisoft says F%%% you, we don't care. The physics engine has no idea what friction is nor how gravity works. If your board TOUCHES anything other than snow, you are dead. The rocks will either have infinite friction, act like magnets and suck you into them, or launch you at infinite speed. This is a major problem in some challenges (BOBSLED CHALLENGE) because the physics make it impossible to even complete. In addition to this, jumping is cruel. You have to jump well before you leave the ramps, so many of the smaller jumps are practically impossible to time properly. You end up with a .05 second window to execute a jump or you fail.NEUTRAL PIECES. The characters are either forgettable or obnoxious. They try to make a story or something out of the game, but nothing is coherent and you just cram challenges in so you get gear, XP, and credits. It would be cool (and really easy) if they made this something like a "career mode" and you created a character and progressed through challenges (kind of like Tony Hawk's Underground back in the day). You just get to Mont Blanc as quickly as possible and forget about any dialogue or any sort of narrative the game tries to feed you.Overall, it is hard to recommend this game. If you can find it on sale, buy it. I paid $40 but still feel bad about the price. If you can get it for $30 or less, then buy it. The concept is excellent and the game is great fun when it is working properly. HOWEVER, when the game is NOT working properly (physics engine, I am looking at you), then it makes you want to punt puppies across the room.tl;dr the game has its moments, but it is so broken in other aspects that it only makes it a 6.5 out of 10. Some challenges are great fun and others make your blood boil.Fix the physics engine and it will easily be a solid 8.5/10. This game is AWESOME when it is working correctly.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 7, 2016
												I think this is currently the best open world Skiing/Snowboarding Game out there.Traverse a large mountain terrain and explore to your hearts content. If you can see it you can walk to it, you can ski on it or you can fly over it.The visuals are amazing, excellent graphics. Decent music/sound effects. Gameplay can be either immensely challenging or soothingly chill as you carve up the slopes pulling off insane tricks or just exploring the vast and beautiful environment.Most of the challenges arent too hard, but there are a few that will have you raging hard to beat them. It was personally pretty satsifying to overcome these, but they are mostly the higher level challenges.The biggest complaint I have seen is about the price tag. Is it worth $60? .. maybe, it is for me personally as I intend to be playing it often just to relax and explore and remind myself of Skiing. This means I will eventually sink at least 80 to 100 hours into the game easily, thus making it a solid investment. If you're looking for something more than that, then maybe perhaps wait for the price to come down a bit to around $40.After about 20 hours of gameplay I have hit max level and unlocked all the mountains, but there is still tonnes of challenges left that I haven't yet gotten gold on and plenty of drop-points/points of interest still left to find.IMO: If you want a Skiing Game that focuses primarily on exploration, then I would say that this is worth getting it for the full price. If you are looking for anything else, wait for a sale.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 7, 2016
												   Whatever you guys think about Ubi, they definetly nailed this one.    If you love racing, skateboarding or just love sports, this is a game for you: Progression system is simple, do activities to level up and gain in game credit in order to unlock or buy all kinds of gear,these gears are all cosmatic, won't affect your performance.Also they have licenses from North Face Salomon and GoPro.    Control is a little hard to familiarize, but just like real snowboarding or skiing, everything needs some practice. Have a controller to play this game is highly recommended but keyboard is not unplayable at all.    A big beautiful open world, dev team's office is located right below Alps, so map model is just outside their office.( And they are gonna add Alaska as DLC)    Game's a MMO, so you can constantly see players doing activities or team up with someone to do some awesome stunts, crack some bones and laugh at each other's crash. Fun is overloading if you have one or two friends playing together    Except for losing connection and Uplay can't log in, everything is perfect.    Ultimatly, you spend full prize to skiiing snowboarding and doing wingsuit jump in one of the most beautiful open world you can get. So grab some buddies, do some stunts crack some bones laugh at each other and have some fun, it's totally worth the prize.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2016
												Steep is an amazing exploration game disguised as an extreme winter sports game. There are, of course, snowboards, skis, wing suits, and parachutes. However, these can be used as tools to discover the massive open-world mountain range as much as they can be used for time challenges and stunts. The joy of this game is hiking the back country and creating your own line on a hidden slope. Steep, in many ways, is about creating your own fun. There is no official cross country skiiing in this game, but you can create your own cross country skiing event. There is no official ice skating in this game, but I once spent 15 minutes ice skating with another player on a frozen lake reachable only by wingsuit and parasail. I once spent 30 minutes climbing a mountain and found kristib112 just sitting at the summit, alone. We waved, stood a while longer, then both base jumped off the cliff, never to see each other again.“You cannot stay on the summit forever; you have to come down again. So why bother in the first place? Just this: What is above knows what is below, but what is below does not know what is above. One climbs, one sees. One descends, one sees no longer, but one has seen.” -- René Daumal, Mount Analogue

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 13
												I've accumulated 31 hours so far over the game and the beta and I highly recommend this game. If you're into snowboarding or skiing type of games, like the old 1080° on the nintendo 64, then you will feel a familiar excitement in playing Steep.   The visuals are beautiful and stunning when properly set up in the options menu. Although to run the game on max settings will take a pretty good GPU, most modern cards won't have any problem handling it on High or Medium. The game engine itself runs extremely well as the physics seem very fluid and lifelike. There is a real level of depth and skill to the game that actually challenges the most dedicated players. Some challenges I found myself trying for hours just to break my top score and then after that, the best score in the world on the leaderboard.  Every good thing has to come with a little bad right, well in this case it's true. Steep to me as a game doesn't feel "complete". The up and coming DLC's seem to have several sports that I would have loved to have included in the base game and not in seasoned releases. For example, Basejumping, Rocketwings and the Bobsleigh will be adding in at later times and of course, you need the Season Pass (30$CAD) to have access to these. Hey at least the new map isn't DLC required, so that's a plus.  The only other downside that I would mention is like the recent Hitman, Steep is an online only game. Though most people wouldn't be phased by this, I've seen some pretty hateful comments going around on this subject.   In terms of multiplayer playability I would recommend finding someone to ride with since meeting people in-game is technically difficult. The only way of interacting with other players is by inviting them to your group or by playing a character emote next to them that spouts out random voice lines. Given that form of communication it's hard to make initial contact with other players in the open world. All in all, Steep is a wonderful game to pass time on and enjoy for hours. You will often find yourself wondering where your past couple of hours went.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 12
												Sportsgame 5/10Environment and nature 10/10Overall 7/10This game is frustrating. Not because its easy, not because its hard, but because it has that annoying combination of brilliance and lazy shortcuts. If you are looking for a snowboard/alpine sportsgame, then Steep will frustrate you endlessly. But at the same time, if you're (like me) not looking for a wingsuit/paraglider, then Steep will surprise you. Its remarkable how the core substance of snowboard and ski are so poorly developed as it is, while the two spicey alternatives both excell so well.I bought Steep for the snowboard offpist sensation. And thats why ive stayed with it. The beauty of this game is remarkable, the snow-physics, the glare, the sound ... it gives me goosebumps regularly, thats how good it is! Steep has genius aspects to it that they just got right. The mapdesign, the quick restartbutton (which had me always doing 20-30 attempts than I intended), the partially amazing voicecasting. These things are a big plus. Thats why its so frustrating that the negatives are just as big. Snowboard and ski has glue-physics to non-snow substance (a small rock can slingshot you 120 degrees around f.ex.), its impossible to swap or pick which direction you want to accelerate, some challenges have ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ pitches and voices, customization of riders are weak, jumps and tricks and score system all make equally little sense. Riding 20m on ice can score just as high as a 1080 tweak for example, whats up with that?? The design choice by devs to build the game up around a «carrier» is a good one, but alas a poorly executed one. In summary, most of these flaws to the game feels to me like they were caused by a lack of more time for developing.All in all, I recommend. Pray that they patch and update the game further. Steep is a dirty, muddied gem. May it shine brighter one day soon.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 26
												Personially I highly enjoy and recomend this game. Its a beautiful and well crafted experance that takes in the wonder of the Swiss Alps, or recently Alaska. It also allows for diffrent players and playstyles to thrive in the same environment, with 3 diffrent modes of transportation: ski/snowbord, wingsuit, and paragliding. If that's all you need to hear, then click "Buy". However, this is deffenitly not a geme for everyone. Here's why:The controlls are purposfully somewhat loose. You might hear people relate this game to SSX, and rightfully so, but you wont be able to do SSX things. In order to jump, you dont just press a button, but release it. To prime a jump you need to hold down the right or left trigger of your controller, and then release it slightly before you wish to jump. For someone who participates in skiing/snowbording this quickly became second nature, but for those who dont, it might take some getting used to. Tricks are some what complicated as well. Directly after initiating a jump, NOT AT THE SAME TIME press a direction on the left joystick to initate rotation, and release to stop rotation. Your rider will right himself durring a jump, but you need to give him time to do so. In order to land well, and not waste g-force meter, you will need to release the direction almost a full second before you reach the ground. When in the air, you can use the left or right trigger to grab with the left or right hand of your rider, and use the left thumbstick to tweak your trick in the air. This all seems very complex, and for some, the inputs to do a simple trick, might be too complexSteep can be repetitive, some chalenges can start to feel the same after a while, and it can be confusing how the maps and chalengs work, as well as finding them in the maps. After all chalenges are complete, you can retry them for a higher score, or just roam the map and find your own lines. The late-game gameplay is very explorative and open ended, and can be offputting for some.Everything is not for everyone. I say that I highly recomend this game and that I love the way it controlls. At the time of writing this review, I have almost 40 hours in the game, and I would guess that about 30 min of that is spent paragliding. Some people might really enjoy paragliding, but it's not for me, and I would say as a general rule, to not go in expecting to love everything about this insainly varried game. it trys to do allot well, and might not hit perfect notes on everything. but what you do find and enjoy, is what makes this game really amazing.With the FREE Alaska dlc, I would recomend steep more than ever now. But buyer be warned, if you like your games to always be fresh every time, and are not one for reppitition, steep might not be for you. If you dont mind that, however, i think you'll really enjoy this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 8, 2016
												Previously I wouldn't have recommended this game but that's no longer the case.This game is great.The scenery is what is stressed by the developers and it does not disappoint. I have found myself sitting on the side of the mountain for brief moments of time looking at the world around me. There is a calming sense of enjoyment with Steep. It's easy to simply sign in and pick up where you left off. The soundtrack is great and offers some customization (filter certain genres of music). Personally I like to ride down a mountain at full speed listening to what relaxing music this game offers me. There isn't an obvious story, nothing for cut scenes. You'll find your own challenges that yield currency and cosmetic awards. All the equipment handles the same, and while you do level up certain styles of playing (free style, extreme riding, pro riding) they grant little more than experience. When you hit the level cap you are able to teleport anywhere you like instead of using challenges and landmarks to get you there. Lets more effectively break down what went right and wrong.The graphics are fluid and show much detail. It is GPU heavy, I run ultra settings w/ my GTX 970, 80 FPS. They have various environmental alterations that you can choose from, night riding, heavy fog, evening, morning etc. This also means that your friends with you will not see the exact same ambiance. Steep offers an easy to use replay mode to record your sessions, take screen shots, and change the ambiance in game for those of you looking for specific shots.The mechanics and physics are on the right track but ultimately become a problem at times. Steep uses a "magnetic" system that will pull your player in any direction in the air. This means that sometimes they will rotate to the side, slamming into a rock or hill. It becomes inconvenient at times. For the most part, it works but you WILL see it happen your first hour into the game. Ubisoft has released 3 updates and none of them have addressed this issue.Finally, the dev involvement is there! They have hopes to push the game into certain directions. There is a free DLC to be released next month with a few new mountains to explore.Definitely worth picking up for those looking for a relaxing game that you can kill time on.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 28
												3/5 stars.  Could be a great game, but some seriously annoying issues. One, ever heard of rails?  Really no grinding tricks in this open world freestyle game?? Is that copyrighted by shaun white's video game or something?  You can wing suit through powerline towers and paraglide back up mountains, switch between snowboarding and skiing...but RAILS?  Devs must been like "WHAT....HOW.....ah let's just not put them in the game, no one will notice"....Friggen 1080 snowboarding on N64 had rails and grinding logic.  Apparenlty that was waaay ahead of its time...Two, absolutely dumb spawns on ridges sometimes if you're in riding mode, which ends up forcing you to go into walking mode to get a better starting angle on the terrain. Spawning on a snowboard in some spots makes it nearly impossible to get moving towards some objective start points that are literally right in front of you (legit have to bug out the character spinning in circles to get them moving in right direction, because character placement and the terrain tend to force character down the slope in the wrong direction.)  Would rather character always spawned in walking mode, or hey give an option in menu to specify defaults like that.Three....really, you can't hit pause during an event else you cancel it...let me just answer my phone or go to the bathroom quick 3/4 through this 5 minute GOLD race timer....o wait I hit pause and cancelled it, lets just restart the whole thing cause that's totally what I wanted to do...completely misleading use of essentially the pause / menu button.4th thing is you can change all keybindings on keyboard, but can't change anything for controllers...cool.  Why the hell is B (on xbox controller when using the map) go back to inital place on map...who the hell wants to do that instead of the intuitive option...EXIT or BACK to gameplay...especially when that button is used to enter the map in the first place. So bad.Some quality of life improvements needed, but other than that its a pretty fun game when stupid things don't happen.  Wouldn't drop 60 bucks on it though, get it on sale.

content:
Posted: March 5
												This game is what is advertised.  Its a online multiplayer free rome mountain ski/snowboard something or other.  There is no guns, zombies, crafting etc.  You do winter/ mountain sports with friends or alone.  There are "missions" and its free roam. Can you play it on any computer and get 60+ frames?  No.  But its not necessarily poorly optimized. The controls work great, the game really looks great, my character does exactly what hes supposed to.  There is  a ton of area on the maps.  You can change your clothes, equipment, charcter etc.  The map is "open" from the start.  You can go anywhere from the beginningif you know how to fly or want to walk for 6 hours.  There are helicopter tickets that you get, but i just fly around.  Otherwise there is a very simple dropzone unlocking deal wich gets you a billion spawn points.  I just stood around and looked thru binoculars and looked at them to unlock.  The game will get a little boring in so many hours.  But I believe I could pick it up at anytime and play an hour or two when ive got time to kill and am looking for a low intensity soothing game to play.  The full price and whatever the extra dlc thing is is overpiced.  I would recommend picking it up on a sale, in my opinion its a 40 dollar game no problem.  It is Ubisoft so there is that.  Although you have to hand it to a company that releases a finshed game instead of an overpriced broken alpha that will never be finished.*Online only *  If the srvers stay up for a few years this is no problem.  Don't buy if its 2020.

But I believe I could pick it up at anytime and play an hour or two when ive got time to kill and am looking for a low intensity soothing game to play.  The full price and whatever the extra dlc thing is is overpiced.  I would recommend picking it up on a sale, in my opinion its a 40 dollar game no problem.  It is Ubisoft so there is that.  Although you have to hand it to a company that releases a finshed game instead of an overpriced broken alpha that will never be finished.*Online only *  If the srvers stay up for a few years this is no problem.  Don't buy if its 2020.

												Amazing game!So much fun. This game is great.I will warn you though, it's a "love it or hate it" type of game.There's no hand holding, and aside from the missions, the game is 100% open-world. It is just you, the mountain, and any friends you bring along with you.If you prefer games that have a thick storyline and linear progression, you probably won't like this game. All unlockables are cosmetic only in Steep, and there isn't any "character progression" as far as unlocking skills/abilities goes. The skill cieling is the player's ability.
